result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricky Tyrone Merritt appeared by video.  Attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal in court for Ricky Tyrone Merritt.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense request to be heard on bail and possible motion to withdraw. State advises of victim notification. Arguments as to bail heard. Court orders Justice point supervision to LEVEL 2 and all other conditions to remain. Off record discussion held. Defense advised of possible new employment and to remain on case as of now. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Conditions of Defendant's Pretrial Release on Bond Order.
Justice Point is reordered - all conditions remain as previously set.

1:47 PM Defendant Ricky Tyrone Merritt appeared by video.  Attorney Lauren Avery Blumenthal appeared by video for Ricky Tyrone Merritt.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ricky Tyrone Merritt in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Ricky Tyrone Merritt in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ricky Tyrone Merritt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  AS TO COUNT 1:   Motion to dismiss by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Count 1 dismissed without prejudice. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
